text: Converts surface geometry to a tetrahedral mesh for use as anatomical bones in a tissue system.
The Bone Solidify SOP iterates over each piece of the input surface geometry and converts it to a tetrahedral mesh using

.   
The input surfaces can arrive as animated geometry, and thus will produce animated output reconstructed as a tetrahedral mesh.
This SOP is part of the Tissue System.
These parameters control the size and density of the output tetrahedra.

A minimum target edge length on the exterior of the bone pieces.
    The surface curvature determines the ideal target size to retain details, however, if the target size is less than this value, the remesher uses this value.

A maximum target edge length on the exterior of the bone pieces.
    The surface curvature determines the ideal target size to retain details, however, if the target size is greater than this value, the remesher uses this value.

The rate at which edge lengths are allowed to change from one surface triangle to the next.
    Higher values generate fewer triangles but overall quality is lower.
This parameter controls the maximum size of individual generated tets on the interior of bone pieces.

This is the static rest position that is converted to a tetrahedral mesh.  If your input mesh is animated, it will be converted according 
    to the position defined by the T-Pose, and the resulting mesh will be deformed to conform to the incoming animated positions.
Timeshift the input geometry animation to the specified frame number, and perform the conversion.
The frame to use for the conversion.
Read a file from disk and use as your conversion source.  The file must have the exact same topology as the input geometry.
The path to the T-Pose geometry file.
Specify a SOP to use as the static T-Pose.  The SOP must have the exact same topology as the input geometry.
The path to the SOP that represents the T-Pose.
These parameters specify how to apply the incoming animation onto the tetrahedral meshes.
Deform the output tet mesh by using the input geometry as a deformation lattice.
If the input geometry has boneCapture attributes, deform the output tet mesh using linear blend skinning deformation.
Transform each piece of the tet mesh output according to the transformation derived from the corresponding piece of the input geometry.

This parameter is enabled when the Bone Animation is set to Point Deform.  The Radius specifies the maximum distance to look for points in the 
    deforming input animation.  Increasing the Radius of the search can have a smoothing effect of the resulting deformation.

This parameter is enabled when the Bone Animation is set to Point Deform.  
    The minimum number of points to be used when looking up points in the deforming input animation.

This parameter is enabled when the Bone Animation is set to Point Deform.  
    The maximum number of points to be used when looking up points in the deforming input animation.

This parameter is enabled when the Bone Animation is set to BoneCapture Deform.  
    Use this toggle to change the relative root for the boneCapture attributes found on the input geometry.
The path points to the top of the object hierarchy where relative boneCapture paths will be traversed.
These parameters allow for reading and writing the converted tet mesh animation to disk.
Switches between passing through the input geometry and loading the geometry from disk.
Where to load the geometry from when in Load from Disk mode. This also controls where the Geometry ROP will save the geometry.
Limits the rendering of frames, when set to Render frame range or Render frame range only.
Save only the geometry generated at the current frame.
Generate the frames in the range set below, but allow the writing to other frames if they are referenced by in-range frames.
Generate the frames in the range set below, and don’t allow writing to other frames, even if they are referenced by in-range frames.

summary: Converts surface geometry to a tetrahedral mesh for use as anatomical bones in a tissue system.

attrs.tags: tetrahedralize, solid, tet mesh, muscle, bone, tissue

title: Bone Solidify
